Phlip wrote:

>James Abley wrote:
>
>  
>
>>I think the suggested way to proceed is to provide a
>>custom version of
>>Assert. You might otherwise by able to do it using
>>an aspect-oriented
>>approach. This
>><http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/12878>
>>thread
>>discussed an approach for hooking into the assertXXX
>>methods like that.
>>    
>>
>
>Ooh look, I figured it out:
>
>find /c/project/ -name \*.java | xargs grep assert |
>wc
>
>  
>

That's ok for Unix platforms and if you don't mind the extra button(s) 
click.....

Can you build it into your testrunner? (OneClickDev) etc.....

Andrew
